property.name: signature
property.descriptionfilespec: checksum file-header chunk in PNG-file. Place to store Interlacing Methods. Looks like this: Bytelength : Name 4 Data Length = 13 4 „IHDR“ 4 Width 4 Height 1 Bit depth 1 Color Type 1 Compression method 1 Filter method 1 Interlace methode 4 CRC

m.mDescription: simple comparison of two values (A, B) of any type on equality. Type of output value: Boolean (true, false).
The hamming distance counts the number of non-corresponding symbols of two ordered sequences. The sequences must have equal length. This version works on arrays of strings.

The Levenshtein distance (syn. Edit distance) is a distance measure for strings. Two strings are compared with respect to the three basic operations insert, delete and replace in order to transform string A into string B. The value for this metric is the number of operations needed for transformation.

Simple match coefficient is a distance measure that uses the hamming distance. In addition, the ratio of non-corresponding values (hamming distance) to the total number of compared pairs of values is calculated. The result is a rational number from range 0.0 to 1.0, indicating maximum similarity (0.0) to minimum (1.0).

Simple match coefficient is a distance measure that uses the hamming distance. In addition, the ratio of non-corresponding values (hamming distance) to the total number of compared pairs of values is calculated. N indicates the n-grams used for comparison. Default setting is N=1. The result is a rational number from range 0.0 to 1.0, indicating maximum similarity (0.0) to minimum (1.0).

property.name: colourSpaceName
property.descriptionfilespec:
file-header chunk in PNG-file. Place to store Interlacing Methods. Looks like this: Bytelength : Name 1 Color Type
PNG image type Colour type Allowed bit depths Interpretation Greyscale 0 1, 2, 4, 8, 16 Each pixel is a greyscale sample Truecolour 2 8, 16 Each pixel is an R,G,B triple Indexed-colour 3 1, 2, 4, 8 Each pixel is a palette index; a PLTE chunk shall appear. Greyscale with alpha 4 8, 16 Each pixel is a greyscale sample followed by an alpha sample. Truecolour with alpha 6 8, 16 Each pixel is an R,G,B triple followed by an alpha sample.

m.mDescription: simple comparison of two values (A, B) of any type on equality. Type of output value: Boolean (true, false).
The hamming distance counts the number of non-corresponding symbols of two ordered sequences. The sequences must have equal length. This version works on arrays of strings.

The Levenshtein distance (syn. Edit distance) is a distance measure for strings. Two strings are compared with respect to the three basic operations insert, delete and replace in order to transform string A into string B. The value for this metric is the number of operations needed for transformation.

Simple match coefficient is a distance measure that uses the hamming distance. In addition, the ratio of non-corresponding values (hamming distance) to the total number of compared pairs of values is calculated. The result is a rational number from range 0.0 to 1.0, indicating maximum similarity (0.0) to minimum (1.0).

Simple match coefficient is a distance measure that uses the hamming distance. In addition, the ratio of non-corresponding values (hamming distance) to the total number of compared pairs of values is calculated. N indicates the n-grams used for comparison. Default setting is N=1. The result is a rational number from range 0.0 to 1.0, indicating maximum similarity (0.0) to minimum (1.0).

property.name: compressionAlgorithm
property.descriptionfilespec: file-header chunk in PNG-file. Place to store Interlacing Methods. Looks like this: Bytelength : Name 4 Data Length = 13 4 „IHDR“ 4 Width 4 Height 1 Bit depth 1 Color Type 1 Compression method 1 Filter method 1 Interlace methode 4 CRC

m.mDescription: simple comparison of two values (A, B) of any type on equality. Type of output value: Boolean (true, false).
The hamming distance counts the number of non-corresponding symbols of two ordered sequences. The sequences must have equal length. This version works on arrays of strings.

The Levenshtein distance (syn. Edit distance) is a distance measure for strings. Two strings are compared with respect to the three basic operations insert, delete and replace in order to transform string A into string B. The value for this metric is the number of operations needed for transformation.

Simple match coefficient is a distance measure that uses the hamming distance. In addition, the ratio of non-corresponding values (hamming distance) to the total number of compared pairs of values is calculated. The result is a rational number from range 0.0 to 1.0, indicating maximum similarity (0.0) to minimum (1.0).

In addition, the ratio of non-corresponding values (hamming distance) to the total number of compared pairs of values is calculated. N indicates the n-grams used for comparison. Default setting is N=1. The result is a rational number from range 0.0 to 1.0, indicating maximum similarity (0.0) to minimum (1.0).

property.name: BitDepth
property.description: Number of bits per sample component
property.descriptionfilespec: file-header chunk in PNG-file. Place to store Interlacing Methods. Looks like this: Bytelength : Name 4 Data Length = 13 4 „IHDR“ 4 Width 4 Height 1 Bit depth 1 Color Type 1 Compression method 1 Filter method 1 Interlace methode 4 CRC

m.mDescription: Root mean squared error is a widely used measure for deviation. It is calculated as the square root of the quotient of the summed up squared diffeences of corresponding values of two sets and as denominator the number of values (values in both sets must have the same number).
simple comparison of two values (A, B) of any type on equality. Type of output value: Boolean (true, false).
Euclidian distance (syn. L2 distance) is a distance measure; the square root of the sum of the single squred differnces of corresponding values of two sets.
The hamming distance counts the number of non-corresponding symbols of two ordered sequences. The sequences must have equal length.
Arithmetical difference of two integer values (A - B)
Product of two integer values (A * B).
Quotient of two integer values (A / B).
Arithmetical sum of two integer values (A +B).

Percental deviation of two values (A,B) of type integer or rational, according to the equation: PercDev= d/A*100. A is the source value, d is the difference of values B and A (B-A). The output value indicates the percental deviation of value B from value A. An output value of PercDev=0.0 indicates equal values.

Simple match coefficient is a distance measure that uses the hamming distance. In addition, the ratio of non-corresponding values (hamming distance) to the total number of compared pairs of values is calculated. The result is a rational number from range 0.0 to 1.0, indicating maximum similarity (0.0) to minimum (1.0).

Simple match coefficient is a distance measure that uses the hamming distance. In addition, the ratio of non-corresponding values (hamming distance) to the total number of compared pairs of values is calculated. N indicates the n-grams used for comparison. Default setting is N=1. The result is a rational number from range 0.0 to 1.0, indicating maximum similarity (0.0) to minimum (1.0).
Standard deviation is a statistical measure for the distribution of the values of a random variable from the arithmetical mean.

property.name: imageHeight
property.description: Height of an image in pixel
property.descriptionfilespec: file-header chunk in PNG-file. Place to store Interlacing Methods. Looks like this: Bytelength : Name 4 Data Length = 13 4 „IHDR“ 4 Width 4 Height 1 Bit depth 1 Color Type 1 Compression method 1 Filter method 1 Interlace methode 4 CRC

property.name: interlace
property.description: Algorithm for encoding raster image data in multiple layers with the purpose of improved transmission and image build-up.
property.descriptionfilespec: file-header chunk in PNG-file. Place to store Interlacing Methods. Looks like this: Bytelength : Name 4 Data Length = 13 4 „IHDR“ 4 Width 4 Height 1 Bit depth 1 Color Type 1 Compression method 1 Filter method 1 Interlace methode 4 CRC

property.description: Width of an image. Corresponds to the x-axis.

property.name: colourPalette
property.description: A colour map for palette colour images. Usually for RGB coloured pictures. Should be an array of hex-colour-values... depending on bitdepth
property.descriptionfilespec: Chunk that containes the Palette for truecolour-PNGs. Use is optional. If the Image containes also an alpha-channel there should also be a bKGD Chunk. Required for colour_type3-PNGs

property.name: alphaTransparency
property.description: Alpha channel transpareny in value 0-255
property.descriptionfilespec: Colourvalue for alphachannel-pictures, containes a 32-Bit-Value. This means the first 3 8-Bits are between 0-255 and refer to RGB-Colour and the last 8-Bit describe the percentage-value of the Alpha-channel (where 0.0=0% and 1.0=100%)

property.name: BackgroundColourRGB
property.description: Hex-Value of a background-colour.
property.descriptionfilespec: solid colour for the background of an image to be used when presenting the image [Compatibility: PNG 1.1]

property.name: 1931CIE_ChromaticityBlueX
property.description: Value x of pair xy specifying blue colour according to 1931 CIE colour-space.
property.descriptionfilespec:
cHRM Primary chromaticities and white point
The four-byte chunk type field contains the decimal values
99 72 82 77
The cHRM chunk may be used to specify the 1931 CIE x,y chromaticities of the red, green, and blue display primaries used in the image, and the referenced white point. See Annex C: Gamma and chromaticity for more information. The iCCP and sRGB chunks provide more sophisticated support for colour management and control.
The cHRM chunk contains: White point x 4 bytes White point y 4 bytes Red x 4 bytes Red y 4 bytes Green x 4 bytes Green y 4 bytes Blue x 4 bytes Blue y 4 bytes
Each value is encoded as a four-byte PNG unsigned integer, representing the x or y value times 100000.
EXAMPLE A value of 0.3127 would be stored as the integer 31270.
The cHRM chunk is allowed in all PNG datastreams, although it is of little value for greyscale images.

property.name: 1931CIE_ChromaticityBlueY
property.description: Value y of pair xy specifying green colour according to 1931 CIE colour space.
property.descriptionfilespec:
cHRM Primary chromaticities and white point
The four-byte chunk type field contains the decimal values
99 72 82 77
The cHRM chunk may be used to specify the 1931 CIE x,y chromaticities of the red, green, and blue display primaries used in the image, and the referenced white point. See Annex C: Gamma and chromaticity for more information. The iCCP and sRGB chunks provide more sophisticated support for colour management and control.
The cHRM chunk contains: White point x 4 bytes White point y 4 bytes Red x 4 bytes Red y 4 bytes Green x 4 bytes Green y 4 bytes Blue x 4 bytes Blue y 4 bytes
Each value is encoded as a four-byte PNG unsigned integer, representing the x or y value times 100000.
EXAMPLE A value of 0.3127 would be stored as the integer 31270.
The cHRM chunk is allowed in all PNG datastreams, although it is of little value for greyscale images.

Quotient of two integer values (A / B).
Arithmetical sum of two integer values (A +B).

Percental deviation of two values (A,B) of type integer or rational, according to the equation: PercDev= d/A*100. A is the source value, d is the difference of values B and A (B-A). The output value indicates the percental deviation of value B from value A. An output value of PercDev=0.0 indicates equal values.

Simple match coefficient is a distance measure that uses the hamming distance. In addition, the ratio of non-corresponding values (hamming distance) to the total number of compared pairs of values is calculated. The result is a rational number from range 0.0 to 1.0, indicating maximum similarity (0.0) to minimum (1.0).

Simple match coefficient is a distance measure that uses the hamming distance. In addition, the ratio of non-corresponding values (hamming distance) to the total number of compared pairs of values is calculated. N indicates the n-grams used for comparison. Default setting is N=1. The result is a rational number from range 0.0 to 1.0, indicating maximum similarity (0.0) to minimum (1.0).
Standard deviation is a statistical measure for the distribution of the values of a random variable from the arithmetical mean.

property.name: 1931CIE_ChromaticityRedX
property.description: Value x of pair xy specifying red colour according to 1931 CIE colour space.
property.descriptionfilespec:
cHRM Primary chromaticities and white point
The four-byte chunk type field contains the decimal values
99 72 82 77
The cHRM chunk may be used to specify the 1931 CIE x,y chromaticities of the red, green, and blue display primaries used in the image, and the referenced white point. See Annex C: Gamma and chromaticity for more information. The iCCP and sRGB chunks provide more sophisticated support for colour management and control.
The cHRM chunk contains: White point x 4 bytes White point y 4 bytes Red x 4 bytes Red y 4 bytes Green x 4 bytes Green y 4 bytes Blue x 4 bytes Blue y 4 bytes
Each value is encoded as a four-byte PNG unsigned integer, representing the x or y value times 100000.
EXAMPLE A value of 0.3127 would be stored as the integer 31270.
The cHRM chunk is allowed in all PNG datastreams, although it is of little value for greyscale images.

m.mDescription: Root mean squared error is a widely used measure for deviation. It is calculated as the square root of the quotient of the summed up squared diffeences of corresponding values of two sets and as denominator the number of values (values in both sets must have the same number).
simple comparison of two values (A, B) of any type on equality. Type of output value: Boolean (true, false).
Euclidian distance (syn. L2 distance) is a distance measure; the square root of the sum of the single squred differnces of corresponding values of two sets.
The hamming distance counts the number of non-corresponding symbols of two ordered sequences. The sequences must have equal length.
Arithmetical difference of two integer values (A - B)
Product of two integer values (A * B).
Quotient of two integer values (A / B).
Arithmetical sum of two integer values (A +B).

Percental deviation of two values (A,B) of type integer or rational, according to the equation: PercDev= d/A*100. A is the source value, d is the difference of values B and A (B-A). The output value indicates the percental deviation of value B from value A. An output value of PercDev=0.0 indicates equal values.

Simple match coefficient is a distance measure that uses the hamming distance. In addition, the ratio of non-corresponding values (hamming distance) to the total number of compared pairs of values is calculated. The result is a rational number from range 0.0 to 1.0, indicating maximum similarity (0.0) to minimum (1.0).

Simple match coefficient is a distance measure that uses the hamming distance. In addition, the ratio of non-corresponding values (hamming distance) to the total number of compared pairs of values is calculated. N indicates the n-grams used for comparison. Default setting is N=1. The result is a rational number from range 0.0 to 1.0, indicating maximum similarity (0.0) to minimum (1.0).
Standard deviation is a statistical measure for the distribution of the values of a random variable from the arithmetical mean.

property.name: filter
property.description: Algorithm applied to data.
property.descriptionfilespec: transformation applied to an array of scanlines with the aim of improving their compressibility [Compatibility: PNG 1.1]

m.mDescription: simple comparison of two values (A, B) of any type on equality. Type of output value: Boolean (true, false).
The hamming distance counts the number of non-corresponding symbols of two ordered sequences. The sequences must have equal length. This version works on arrays of strings.

The Levenshtein distance (syn. Edit distance) is a distance measure for strings. Two strings are compared with respect to the three basic operations insert, delete and replace in order to transform string A into string B. The value for this metric is the number of operations needed for transformation.

Simple match coefficient is a distance measure that uses the hamming distance. In addition, the ratio of non-corresponding values (hamming distance) to the total number of compared pairs of values is calculated. The result is a rational number from range 0.0 to 1.0, indicating maximum similarity (0.0) to minimum (1.0).

Simple match coefficient is a distance measure that uses the hamming distance. In addition, the ratio of non-corresponding values (hamming distance) to the total number of compared pairs of values is calculated. N indicates the n-grams used for comparison. Default setting is N=1. The result is a rational number from range 0.0 to 1.0, indicating maximum similarity (0.0) to minimum (1.0).

property.name: gammaValueRGB
property.description: Level of brightness for pixels ranging from black (0) to white (1). These pixel values serve as the input for the computer monitor. The sRGB and Adobe RGB colour spaces are also based on a gamma of 2.2. Gamma-encoding is supported by certain imagefile formats.
property.descriptionfilespec: describes the gamma-values in a PNG-file. "...Specifies the relationship between the image samples and the desired display output intensity. ...It is also necessary to specify the viewing conditions under which the output is desired. For gAMA these are the reference viewing conditions of the sRGB specifications. The value is encoded as a four-byte PNG unsigned integer, representing gamma times 100000. EXAMPLE A gamma of 1/2.2 would be stored as the integer 45455"

m.mDescription: Root mean squared error is a widely used measure for deviation. It is calculated as the square root of the quotient of the summed up squared diffeences of corresponding values of two sets and as denominator the number of values (values in both sets must have the same number).
simple comparison of two values (A, B) of any type on equality. Type of output value: Boolean (true, false).

property.name: paletteHistogram
property.description: Approximate usage frequency of each colour in the palette index (rgbPalette).
property.descriptionfilespec: Histogramme chunk for PNGs "The hIST chunk gives the approximate usage frequency of each colour in the palette. A histogram chunk can appear only when a PLTE chunk appears. If a viewer is unable to provide all the colours listed in the palette, the histogram may help it decide how to choose a subset of the colours for display"

m.mDescription: Root mean squared error is a widely used measure for deviation. It is calculated as the square root of the quotient of the summed up squared diffeences of corresponding values of two sets and as denominator the number of values (values in both sets must have the same number).
simple comparison of two values (A, B) of any type on equality. Type of output value: Boolean (true, false).
Euclidian distance (syn. L2 distance) is a distance measure; the square root of the sum of the single squred differnces of corresponding values of two sets.

In addition, the ratio of non-corresponding values (hamming distance) to the total number of compared pairs of values is calculated. N indicates the n-grams used for comparison. Default setting is N=1. The result is a rational number from range 0.0 to 1.0, indicating maximum similarity (0.0) to minimum (1.0).

property.name: ICCProfileName
property.description: Name of the description of the colour space (in the form of an International Colour Consortium (ICC) profile) to which the samples in the image conform, should be something like: sRGB IEC1966-2.1, Adobe RGB ´98, for cmyk: ISO Coated V2 (ECI) and ISO Uncoated.
property.descriptionfilespec:
Containes ICC-Profile-Data. Profile name: 1-79 bytes (character string) Null separator: 1 byte (null character) Compression method: 1 byte Compressed profile: n bytes
If the iCCP chunk is present, the image samples conform to the colour space represented by the embedded ICC profile as defined by the International colour Consortium [ICC]. The colour space of the ICC profile shall be an RGB colour space for colour images (PNG colour types 2, 3, and 6), or a greyscale colour space for greyscale images (PNG colour types 0 and 4).

property.name: resolutionUnit
property.description: Name of the Unit that measures the resolution of theiImage. If it is none: default is generally inch.
property.descriptionfilespec:
pHYs Physical pixel dimensions
The four-byte chunk type field contains the decimal values
112 72 89 115
The pHYs chunk specifies the intended pixel size or aspect ratio for display of the image. It contains: Pixels per unit, X axis 4 bytes (PNG unsigned integer) Pixels per unit, Y axis 4 bytes (PNG unsigned integer) Unit specifier 1 byte
The following values are defined for the unit specifier: 0 unit is unknown 1 unit is the metre
When the unit specifier is 0, the pHYs chunk defines pixel aspect ratio only; the actual size of the pixels remains unspecified.
If the pHYs chunk is not present, pixels are assumed to be square, and the physical size of each pixel is unspecified.

m.mDescription: simple comparison of two values (A, B) of any type on equality. Type of output value: Boolean (true, false).
The hamming distance counts the number of non-corresponding symbols of two ordered sequences. The sequences must have equal length. This version works on arrays of strings.

The Levenshtein distance (syn. Edit distance) is a distance measure for strings. Two strings are compared with respect to the three basic operations insert, delete and replace in order to transform string A into string B. The value for this metric is the number of operations needed for transformation.

In addition, the ratio of non-corresponding values (hamming distance) to the total number of compared pairs of values is calculated. The result is a rational number from range 0.0 to 1.0, indicating maximum similarity (0.0) to minimum (1.0).

Simple match coefficient is a distance measure that uses the hamming distance. In addition, the ratio of non-corresponding values (hamming distance) to the total number of compared pairs of values is calculated. N indicates the n-grams used for comparison. Default setting is N=1. The result is a rational number from range 0.0 to 1.0, indicating maximum similarity (0.0) to minimum (1.0).

property.name: significantBits
property.description: Number of bits that are significant in the samples.
property.descriptionfilespec:
Significant Bits: "11.3.3.4 sBIT Significant bits
The four-byte chunk type field contains the decimal values
115 66 73 84
To simplify decoders, PNG specifies that only certain sample depths may be used, and further specifies that sample values should be scaled to the full range of possible values at the sample depth. The sBIT chunk defines the original number of significant bits (which can be less than or equal to the sample depth). This allows PNG decoders to recover the original data losslessly even if the data had a sample depth not directly supported by PNG.
The sBIT chunk contains: Colour type 0 significant greyscale bits 1 byte Colour types 2 and 3 significant red bits 1 byte significant green bits 1 byte significant blue bits 1 byte Colour type 4 significant greyscale bits 1 byte significant alpha bits 1 byte Colour type 6 significant red bits 1 byte significant green bits 1 byte significant blue bits 1 byte significant alpha bits 1 byte"

m.mDescription: Root mean squared error is a widely used measure for deviation. It is calculated as the square root of the quotient of the summed up squared diffeences of corresponding values of two sets and as denominator the number of values (values in both sets must have the same number).
simple comparison of two values (A, B) of any type on equality. Type of output value: Boolean (true, false).
Euclidian distance (syn. L2 distance) is a distance measure; the square root of the sum of the single squred differnces of corresponding values of two sets.
The hamming distance counts the number of non-corresponding symbols of two ordered sequences. The sequences must have equal length.
Arithmetical difference of two integer values (A - B)
Product of two integer values (A * B).
Quotient of two integer values (A / B).
Arithmetical sum of two integer values (A +B).

The output value indicates the percental deviation of value B from value A. An output value of PercDev=0.0 indicates equal values.

In addition, the ratio of non-corresponding values (hamming distance) to the total number of compared pairs of values is calculated. The result is a rational number from range 0.0 to 1.0, indicating maximum similarity (0.0) to minimum (1.0).

Simple match coefficient is a distance measure that uses the hamming distance. In addition, the ratio of non-corresponding values (hamming distance) to the total number of compared pairs of values is calculated. N indicates the n-grams used for comparison. Default setting is N=1. The result is a rational number from range 0.0 to 1.0, indicating maximum similarity (0.0) to minimum (1.0).
Standard deviation is a statistical measure for the distribution of the values of a random variable from the arithmetical mean.

property.name: renderingIntent
property.description: The way colour-information is displayed: AbsoluteColourmetric. RelativeColourmetric. Saturation. Perception. Mapped from PNG (where it is an integer) via "same_as" but should be mapped via "int_to_string".
property.descriptionfilespec:
indicates that the standard sRGB colour space is used. The sRGB chunk contains: Rendering intent: 1 byte The following values are defined for rendering intent: 0: Perceptual, for images preferring good adaptation to the output device gamut at the expense of colourimetric accuracy, such as photographs.
1: Relative colourimetric, for images requiring colour appearance matching (relative to the output device white point), such as logos.
2: Saturation, for images preferring preservation of saturation at the expense of hue and lightness, such as charts and graphs. 3: Absolute colourimetric, for images requiring preservation of absolute colourimetry, such as previews of images destined for a different output device (proofs).

m.mDescription: simple comparison of two values (A, B) of any type on equality. Type of output value: Boolean (true, false).
The hamming distance counts the number of non-corresponding symbols of two ordered sequences. The sequences must have equal length. This version works on arrays of strings.

The Levenshtein distance (syn. Edit distance) is a distance measure for strings. Two strings are compared with respect to the three basic operations insert, delete and replace in order to transform string A into string B. The value for this metric is the number of operations needed for transformation.

Simple match coefficient is a distance measure that uses the hamming distance. In addition, the ratio of non-corresponding values (hamming distance) to the total number of compared pairs of values is calculated. The result is a rational number from range 0.0 to 1.0, indicating maximum similarity (0.0) to minimum (1.0).

Simple match coefficient is a distance measure that uses the hamming distance. In addition, the ratio of non-corresponding values (hamming distance) to the total number of compared pairs of values is calculated. N indicates the n-grams used for comparison. Default setting is N=1. The result is a rational number from range 0.0 to 1.0, indicating maximum similarity (0.0) to minimum (1.0).

property.name: suggestedPaletteAlpha
property.description: Alpha value for suggested palette.

m.mDescription: Root mean squared error is a widely used measure for deviation. It is calculated as the square root of the quotient of the summed up squared diffeences of corresponding values of two sets and as denominator the number of values (values in both sets must have the same number).
simple comparison of two values (A, B) of any type on equality. Type of output value: Boolean (true, false).
Euclidian distance (syn. L2 distance) is a distance measure; the square root of the sum of the single squred differnces of corresponding values of two sets.
The hamming distance counts the number of non-corresponding symbols of two ordered sequences. The sequences must have equal length.
Arithmetical difference of two integer values (A - B)
Product of two integer values (A * B).
Quotient of two integer values (A / B).
Arithmetical sum of two integer values (A +B).

Percental deviation of two values (A,B) of type integer or rational, according to the equation: PercDev= d/A*100. A is the source value, d is the difference of values B and A (B-A). The output value indicates the percental deviation of value B from value A. An output value of PercDev=0.0 indicates equal values.

Simple match coefficient is a distance measure that uses the hamming distance. In addition, the ratio of non-corresponding values (hamming distance) to the total number of compared pairs of values is calculated. The result is a rational number from range 0.0 to 1.0, indicating maximum similarity (0.0) to minimum (1.0).

Simple match coefficient is a distance measure that uses the hamming distance. In addition, the ratio of non-corresponding values (hamming distance) to the total number of compared pairs of values is calculated. N indicates the n-grams used for comparison. Default setting is N=1. The result is a rational number from range 0.0 to 1.0, indicating maximum similarity (0.0) to minimum (1.0).
Standard deviation is a statistical measure for the distribution of the values of a random variable from the arithmetical mean.

property.description: Frequency of suggested palette.
property.descriptionfilespec: frequency of suggested palette

property.name: suggestedPaletteRGB
property.description: Name of a reduced palette that may be used when the display device is not capable of displaying the full range of colours in the image.
property.descriptionfilespec: name of a reduced palette that may be used when the display device is not capable of displaying the full range of colours in the image [Compatibility: PNG 1.1]

property.name: textData
property.descriptionfilespec: PNG-Chunk containing Latin-1-encoded Text. can be compressed textual data (with deflate of zlib). The flag is then 0, uncompressed is 1

property.name: documentModificationDate
property.descriptionfilespec:
chunk that containes the time, the file was last changed. It contains: Year 2 bytes (complete; for example, 1995, not 95) Month 1 byte (1-12) Day 1 byte (1-31) Hour 1 byte (0-23) Minute 1 byte (0-59) Second 1 byte (0-60) (to allow for leap seconds)
Universal Time (UTC) should be specified rather than local time.

m.mDescription: simple comparison of two values (A, B) of any type on equality. Type of output value: Boolean (true, false).

property.name: simpleTransparency
property.description: Simple transparency in opposition to alpha-transparency (and the RGB-value for the colour which is set to be transparent).
property.descriptionfilespec: PNG-Chunk that containes the value for a simple transparency-colour (in opposite to alpha-channels). For indexed images, it stores alpha channel values for one or more palette entries. For truecolour and greyscale images (greyscale) and colour_type2 (simple true-colour), it stores a single pixel value that is to be regarded as fully transparent.

property.name: textualAnnotation
property.description: General textual annotation - not formatted in any kind of metadata-standards like METS.
